bib.title: Dissociation of reading and naming in ventral occipitotemporal cortex
bib.author: Oscar Woolnough and Nitin Tandon
bib.abstract: Lesions in language-dominant ventral occipitotemporal cortex (vOTC) can result in selective impairment of either reading and naming, resulting in alexia or anomia. Yet, functional imaging studies that show differential activation for naming and reading do not reveal activity exclusively tuned to one of these inputs.To resolve this dissonance in the functional architecture of vOTC, we used focused stimulation to the vOTC in 49 adult patients during reading and naming, and generated a population-level, probabilistic map to evaluate if reading and naming are clearly dissociable within individuals.
